Chapter 13-1 
 
Municipal Tree Regulations 
 
 
 
 
Chapter 13-2 
 
Noxious Weeds 
 
 
 
CHAPTER 13-1 
 
MUNICIPAL TREE REGULATIONS 
 
13-1-1 
 
TITLE 
This chapter shall be known and may be cited as the Municipal Tree Regulations of the 
City of Brandon, Minnehaha County, South Dakota. 
 
 
 
 
Legislative History: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-2 
 
DEFINITIONS 
  
 
 
A.    
"Street Trees" are herein defined as the trees and all other wood vegetation on  
  
 
 
  
land lying between the right of way lines of all streets, avenues, alleys or other  
  
 
 
 
public right of way within the City. 
 
 
 
B.    
"Park Trees" are herein defined as trees and all other wood vegetation in public  
  
 
 
 
parks, playgrounds and all other areas owned by the City, or to 
  
 
 
 
which the public has free access as a park or playground. 
C.  
"Parkway or Boulevard" are herein defined as the paved or unpaved strip of land  
  
adjacent to the roadway and located between the roadway and the 
  
sidewalk area or the property line and in the right of way. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL § 50-10-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-3 
 
GENERAL AUTHORITY OF CITY 
The City of Brandon may provide for the necessary attention or action insofar as trees, 
brush, wood, shrubbery or debris: 
A. Infected with any major disease or pest; or 
B. In the right of way. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL § 9-45-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-4 
 
AUTHORITY ADMINISTRATION; PLANTING, MAINTENANCE AND  
 
 
 
REMOVAL OF TREES, PUBLIC SAFETY 
The Mayor and City Council of the City of Brandon, through its Superintendent of Parks, 
has the authority to: 
A. Administer the provisions of this chapter, unless otherwise specifically provided; 
B. Study the problems and determine the needs of the City;  
C. Determine the type and kind of trees to be placed upon all municipal public streets or 
parts of public streets or in parks;  
D. Assist in the dissemination of news and information regarding the selection, planting 

and maintenance of trees, shrubs and bushes within City limits or within the area 
over which the municipal officials have jurisdiction, whether the same be on private 
or public property; 
E. Regulate the planting, maintenance and removal of trees on streets and other publicly 
owned property to insure safety or preserve the aesthetics of such public sites.   
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL § 9-45-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
 
13-1-5 
 
PRUNING TREES, THE MINIMUM CLEARANCE 
It shall be the duty of any person or persons owning or occupying real property bordering 
on any street upon which property there may be trees, to prune such trees in such manner 
that they will not obstruct or shade the street lights, obstruct the passage of pedestrians or 
bicyclists on sidewalks, obstruct vision of traffic signs, or obstruct view of any street or 
alley intersection, except where such services are provided for by utility firms or the City. 
 
 
The minimum clearance for any overhanging portion thereof over a sidewalk shall be ten 
(10) feet whenever practicable, and shall be twelve (12) feet over all streets except truck 
thoroughfares when the clearance shall be from fourteen (14) to sixteen (16) feet, unless 
otherwise designated by the City Council. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL § 9-45-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #449, 06/03/09 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-6 
 
HARMFUL ACTIVITIES TO TREES PROHIBITED 
Unless otherwise specifically authorized by the City Council or Park Superintendent, no 
person shall intentionally damage or carve any boulevard tree, attach any rope, wire, 
nails, advertising posters or other contrivances to any boulevard tree; allow any gaseous

liquid or solid substance which is harmful to such boulevard trees to come in contact with 
them; or to set fire or permit any fire to burn when such fire or the heat therefrom will 
injure any portion of any  tree. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
     
SDCL §§ 22-34-1, 9-45-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
 
13-1-7 
 
SAFETY HAZARDS TO THE PUBLIC, DISEASES 
No tree, shrub or brush shall be allowed to harbor any safety hazard to the general public, 
whether that tree, shrub or bush be public or private, or to harbor any insect, disease or 
other pest that would be injurious or fatal to any tree, shrub and bush in the City.  Such 
trees, shrubs and bushes include those injurious to sewer, water, electrical, telephone or 
gas lines, and those interfering with traffic and traffic control devices and signs, those 
obstructing light from any street light and those that are dead or have broken or dead 
limbs that are unsafe. 
 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL § 9-45-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 

13-1-8 
 
NUISANCES; NOTICE TO OWNERS; NOTICE CONTENT;  
 
 
 
PREMISE INSPECTIONS 
As to any Street, Parkway or Boulevard Tree, any hazard as described in Section 7 shall 
be declared a nuisance by the City Council and, except as otherwise provided herein,  
within thirty days of written notice of said nuisance, the same shall be corrected by the 
responsible owner or person in possession of said tree. 
 
As to any Tree on private property that is a hazard as described in Section 7, Brandon 
Ordinance 7-2 shall be followed.  
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
1990 Revisions. 
SDCL §§ 9-29-31 9-32-12, 34-16-19  
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
and 34-16-20. 
 
 
13-1-9 
 
REMOVAL COSTS; COLLECTION OF 
The cost of any abatement of a hazard related to Street, Parkway or Boulevard Tree shall 
be borne by the City.  The cost related to a hazard on private property shall be borne by 
the property owner.  In the event owner, occupant or person fails to comply with removal 
of a hazard, abatement procedures as set forth in Brandon Ordinance 7-2 shall be 
followed with collection of costs expended by the City to be collected as set forth by law. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL Ch. 21-10. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
 
Cross Reference:  Ordinance 13-1-2(c). 
 
 
13-1-10  
 
WOOD STORAGE AND SALES 
No wood from any tree known to be a carrier for any serious disease or pest may be 
stored in piles or in any other place within the City or be sold within the City.  Any 
qualifying wood must be immediately shredded, buried or burned. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL § 9-21-31. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-11  
 
COST ASSESSMENTS;  RECORDS 
The Finance Officer shall keep an account of all costs of tree removals and other 
nuisances abated under this chapter in the event assessments are necessary. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
      
SDCL Ch. 21-10 generally. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-12  
 
INTERFERENCE BY INDIVIDUALS 
It shall be unlawful for any person to hinder, prevent, delay or interfere with the City 
Council or any member thereof or the Park Superintendent or any other representative of 
said City Council, whomsoever that might be, while engaged in carrying out the 
execution or enforcement of this chapter, provided, however, that nothing herein shall be 
construed as an attempt to prohibit the pursuit of any remedy, legal or equitable, in any 
court of competent jurisdiction for the protection of property rights by the owner of any 
property within the Municipality. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority:

Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 

13-1-13  
 
BUILDING BESIDE TREES 
No person shall deposit, place, store or maintain upon any public place of the City any

stone, brick, sand, concrete or other materials which may impede the free passage of 
water, air, and fertilizer to the roots of any tree growing therein, except by written permit 
of the City Council or Park Superintendent. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions. 
 
 
 
SDCL § 9-45-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-14  
 
PLANTING TREES IN BOULEVARD, TREE PERMIT REQUIRED 
No person may plant, transplant or move any tree or shrub in the boulevard of a public 
street or on any public grounds without first obtaining a written “tree permit” from the 
City of Brandon to do such work.  A tree permit fee will be determined by the Brandon 
City Council.  The tree permit shall reflect at least the following information: name and 
address of the owner of the property, the name and address of the person doing the work, 
the type and location of the tree to be planted.

Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions

Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-15  
 
TYPE OF TREES ALLOWED IN THE STREET BOULEVARD 
The Brandon City Council shall establish a list of approved trees that may be planted in 
the street boulevard and other public grounds. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
1990 Revisions 
 
 
 
SDCL § 9-45-1. 
Ordinance No. 321, 10//7/02. 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-16  
 
REGULATION FOR PLANTING TREES IN THE BOULEVARD 
After a permit has been obtained, the planting shall be completed in accordance with the 
following regulations. 
 
A. 
No tree or planting shall be planted or permitted to grow in such a manner as to 
impede vision between a height of three (3) feet and ten (10) feet above the 
centerline grades of the intersecting streets in the area bounded by the curb lines 
of such corner lots and a line joining points along said street lines forty (40) feet 
from the point of intersection as stated in Brandon Municipal Code 15-14-1. 
B. 
No tree shall be planted where the distance from the sidewalk to the back of the 
curb is less than five (5) feet. 
C. 
No tree shall be planted closer than three (3) feet from the back of the curb. 
D. 
Trees shall be planted a minimum of 30 feet apart unless with prior written 
approval from the City of Brandon. 
E. 
The expense for planting and care of trees shall be the responsibility of the 
owner of the adjacent property. 
F. 
Only designated trees from the City’s approved list shall be planted on the 
boulevard. 
G. 
The owner of property shall locate all utilities by placing a call to South Dakota 
One Call prior to planting. 
H. 
Trees shall be placed at least 10 feet from a fire hydrant. 
I. 
Trees shall be placed at least 15 feet from a street light. 

J. 
Trees shall be placed at least 20 feet back from a stop/yield sign. 
K. 
No trees shall be placed on any property line. 
 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority:

SDCL § 9-45-1. 
Ordinance No. 321, 10//7/02 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
13-1-17  
 
TREE BOARD 
There is hereby created and established a Tree Board for the City of Brandon, which shall 
consist of the members of the City's Brandon Park Advisory Committee and one member 
of the City Council.  Vacancies on the Tree Board shall be filled as consistent with 
vacancies on the Brandon Park Advisory Committee. 
 
Legislative History: 
Authority: 
 
 
 
Ordinance No. 420, 4/20/08. 
 
 
SDCL § 9-45-1. 
 
 
 
Ordinance No. 560, 3/20/18. 
 
 
 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
 
13-1-18 
 
TREATMENTS 
Any treatments of boulevard trees for disease or pest must be registered with the City and 
marked with tags approved by the City.  Any tags shall be placed on the street side of the 
tree in such a way that they are visible from the adjacent roadway and shall be affixed to 
the tree for at least 730 days after treatment.  All costs for treatments shall be the 
responsibility of the adjacent property.  All treatments of boulevard trees must be done

with a City licensed entity from the City’s approved list. 
 
Legislative History: 
Ordinance #600, 03/18/20 
 
13-1-19 
 
REMOVALS 
 
Any removal by a property owner of any Street, Parkway or Boulevard Tree for reasons 
other than disease, pest, visibility or safety hazards must first be approved by the City.

Ordinance #600, 03/18/20
